χρῆσθαί τινι εἴς τι to use for an end or purpose, Hdt., Xen., etc.; ἐπί τι or πρός τι Xen.;—also with neut. adj. as adv., χρ. τινι ὅ τι βούλεταί τις to make what use one likes of him, Hdt.; ἀπορέων ὅ τι χρήσεται not knowing what to make of it, Hdt.; τί χρήσομαι τούτωι; what use shall I make of him? Ar.; οὐκ ἂν ἔχοις ὅ τι χρῶιο σαυτῶι Plat.

of persons, χρῆσθαί τινι, with an adv. of manner, to treat him so and so, χρῆσθαί τινι ὡς ἀνδρὶ ψεύστηι Hdt.; χρῆσθαί τινι ὡς φίλωι Thuc.; also, φιλικῶς χρῆσθαί τινι Xen.; but ὡς is often omitted, ἔμοιγε χρώμενος διδασκάλωι Aesch., etc.:—also, χρῆσθαί τινι (without φίλωι) like Lat. uti for uti familiariter, to be intimate with a man, Xen.:—absol., οἱ χρώμενοι friends, Xen.
χρῆσθαι ἑαυτῶι to make use of oneʼs powers, Plat.; also, παρέχειν ἑαυτόν τινι χρῆσθαι to place oneself at the disposal of another, Xen.
absol., or with an adv., οὕτω χρῶνται οἱ Πέρσαι so the Persians are wont to do, such is their custom, Xen.
perf. κέχρημαι (in pres. sense), to be in need or want of, to yearn after, c. gen., Hom., Soph., Eur.:—part. κεχρημένος used as an adj., needy, in need, poor, Od., Hes., Eur.
the perf. appears as a strengthd. pres., to have in use, and so to have, possess, φρεσὶ γὰρ κέχρητʼ ἀγαθῆισι Od.
aor1 pass. χρησθῆναι, to be used, αἱ νέες οὐκ ἐχρήσθησαν Hdt.; ἕως ἂν χρησθῆι so long as it be in use, Dem.
for χρή, v. sub voc.

div1.head: χραύω
div1.sense: to scrape, graze, wound slightly, ὅν ῥά τε ποιμὴν χραύσῃ Il.; cf. ἐγχραύω, ἐπιχράω.

div1.head: χράω
div1.sense: c. dat. pers. to fall upon, attack, assail, στυγερὸς δέ οἱ ἔχραε δαίμων Od.

c. inf. to be bent on doing, to be eager to do, τίπτε ἐμὸν ῥόον ἔχραε κήδειν; why was he so eager to vex my stream? Il.; μνηστῆρες, οἳ ἐχράετε ἐσθιέμεν καὶ πινέμεν ye suitors, who were so eager to eat and drink, Od.

to this must also be referred the forms χρῆις, χρῆι, (formed like λῆις, λῆι from λάω, διψῆις, -ῆι, πεινῆις, -ῆι from διψάω, πεινάω) = χρῄζω, to desire, εἴτε χρῆι θανεῖν whether she desires to die, Soph.; δρᾶν ἃ χρῆις Soph.; εἴτε χρῆις (sc. κηρύσσειν με) Soph.; οὐ χρῆισθα (sc. φωνεῖν); Ar.

div1.head: χράω
div1.sense: Act. of gods and oracles, to furnish the needful answer, to declare, pronounce, proclaim, χρήσω βουλὴν Διός Hhymn.; ἡ Πυθίη οἱ χρᾶι τάδε Hdt., etc.: c. inf. to warn or direct by oracle, χρήσαντʼ ἐμοὶ ἐκτὸς αἰτίας εἶναι that I should be, Aesch.; τοῦ θεοῦ χρήσαντος Thuc.

Pass. to be declared, proclaimed by an oracle, τίς οὖν ἐχρήσθη; Eur.; of the oracle, τὰ χρηστήρια ταῦτά σφι ἐχρήσθη Hdt.; πείθου τὰ χρησθέντʼ Soph.: impers., c. inf., καί σφι ἐχρήσθη ἀνέμοισι εὔχεσθαι Hdt.

Mid. to consult a god or oracle, to inquire of a god or oracle, consult him or it, c. dat., ψυχῆι χρησόμενος Τειρεσίαο Od.; χρ. θεῶι, Lat. uti oraculo, Hdt., etc. —From the sense of using an oracle comes the general sense of χράομαι to use (v. χράομαι):—absol. to consult the oracle, Od., Hdt.; οἱ χρώμενοι the consulters, Eur.:—perf. part., κεχρημένος one who has received an oracular response, Arist.

to furnish with a thing, in which sense κίχρημι was the pres. in use, with fut. χρήσω: aor1 ἔχρησα: perf. κέχρηκα:— Mid., pres. in use κίχραμαι, aor1 ἐχρησάμην: — to furnish the use of a thing, i. e. to lend, Hdt., Ar., etc.:—Mid. to have furnished one, borrow, Eur.; πόδας χρήσας, ὄμματα χρησάμενος having lent feet and borrowed eyes, of a blind man carrying a lame one, Anth.

div1.head: χρεία
div1.sense: use, advantage, service, Theogn., Plat.; τὰ οὐδὲν εἰς χρείαν things of no use or service, Dem.; χρείαν ἐρευνᾶν, v. ἐρευνάω 1: —pl. services, Pind., Dem.
as an action, using, use, κτῆσις καὶ χρ. having and using, Xen., Plat.; πρὸς τὴν ἀνθρωπίνην χρ. Xen.
of persons, familiarity, intimacy, intercourse, πρός τινα with one, Plat.

like Lat. opus, need, want, necessity, Aesch., etc.; ἵνʼ ἕσταμεν χρείας considering in what great need we are, Soph.; χρείᾳ πολεμεῖν to war with necessity, Soph.:—c. gen. want or lack of a thing, Aesch., etc.; ἐν χρείᾳ δορός in the need or stress of war, Soph.; χρεία ἐστί γίγνεταί μοι τινός, Lat. opus est mihi aliqua re, Plat.; ἔτι μου χρείαν ἕξει will have need of my help, Aesch.; ἐν χρείᾳ εἶναί or γίγνεσθαί τινος Plat.; pl., αἱ τοῦ σώματος χρ. Xen.; αἱ ἀναγκαῖαι χρ. Dem.
the result of need, want, poverty, Soph., Eur.
a request of necessity, opp. to ἀξίωσις (a claim of merit), Thuc.: generally, a request, Aesch.
a needful business, a need, requirement, ὡς πρὸς τί χρείας; for what purpose? Soph.; ἡ πολεμικὴ χρ. καὶ ἡ εἰρηνική the requirements of war and of peace, Arist.
generally, a business, employment, Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: χρεῖος
div1.sense: needing, being in want of, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: χρεμετίζω
div1.sense: to neigh, whinny, Lat. hinnire, of horses, Il., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: χρεμετισμός
div1.sense: a neighing, whinnying, Ar.

div1.head: χρέμπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to clear oneʼs throat, to hawk and spit, cough, Eur.

div1.head: χρέος
div1.sense: that which one needs must pay, an obligation, debt, Od.; a debt for stolen cattle, Il.; χρεῖος ἀποστήσασθαι to pay a debt in full, Il.; ἀρᾶς τίνει χρ. pays the debt demanded by the curse, Aesch.; χρέος πόλει προσάπτειν to attach a further debt, i.e. guilt to the city, Soph.; χρέος ἀποδιδόναι to repay a debt, Hdt., Ar.:—in pl. debts, χρειῶν λύσις Hes.; τὴν οὐσίαν ἅπασαν χρέα κατέλιπε left all the property in outstanding debts, Dem.
a needful business, an affair, matter, ἑὸν αὐτοῦ χρεῖος Od.: a requirement, a purpose, Soph.: c. gen., like χάριν, for the sake of, σὸν οὐκ ἔλασσον ἢ κείνης χρέος Eur.
like χρῆμα, a thing, τί χρέος; τί χρῆμα; wherefore? Aesch.; ἐφʼ ὅ τι χρ. ἐμόλετε; Eur.
in Od., ἦλθον Τειρεσίαο κατὰ χρέος seems to be = Τειρεσίᾳ χρησόμενος, I came to consult him:—but, κατὰ χρέος according to what is due, as is meet, Hhymn.
a duty, task, charge, office, Pind., Trag.
= χρεία, want, need, τί δὲ τοῦδʼ ἔχει πλέκους χρέος; Ar.

div1.head: χρεωκοπίδης
div1.sense: one who cancels his debts, an insolvent, Plut.

div1.head: χρεών
div1.etym: indecl., properly a part. neut. of χρή
div1.sense: that which must be, τὸ χρεὼν γίνεσθαι Hdt.; τὸ χρεὼν τοῦ χρησμοῦ Plut.
need, necessity, fate, Eur., Plat.
χρεών (sc. ἐστι) , much like χρή, ʼtis fated, necessary, Lat. oportet, c. inf., Theogn., Aesch., etc.
sometimes as a neut. part. (like ἐξόν, etc.), it being necessary, since it was necessary, Hdt.
more rarely that which is expedient or right, Soph., Ar., etc.
absol., οὐ χρεὼν ἄρχετε ye rule unrightfully, Thuc.

div1.head: χρεώ
div1.sense: want, need; hence desire, longing, urgent wish, Hom.; ἦ τι μάλα χρεώ of a truth something is much needed, Il.; χρειοῖ ἀναγκαίῃ by dire necessity, Il.; c. gen., χρειὼ ἐμεῖο want, need of me, Hom.
χρειὼ ἱκάνεται want, necessity arises, Hom.; so, χρειὼ γίγνεται Il.; τίπτε δέ σε χρειὼ δεῦρʼ ἤγαγε; Od.
χρ. ἱκάνει τινά comes upon him, ἐμὲ δὲ χρεὼ γίγνεται αὐτῆς (sc. τῆς νηός) need of the ship comes upon me, Il.; οὐδέ τί μιν χρεὼ ἔσται τυμβοχοῆς nor will need of a grave be felt by him, Il.

hence the elliptical use of χρεώ c. acc. pers., τίπτε δέ σε χρεώ (sc. ἱκάνει) ; Hom.; c. gen. rei, οὔτι με ταύτης χρεὼ τιμῆς need of it touches me not, Il.; χρεὼ βουλῆς ἐμὲ καὶ σέ Il.;—also c. inf., τὸν χρεὼ ἑστάμεναι κρατερῶς he needs must stand firm, Il.; οὐδέ τί μιν χρεὼ νηῶν ἐπιβαινέμεν Od.
div1.etym: χρέω in Hom. is a monosyll.

div1.head: χρεώστης
div1.sense: a debtor, Luc.

div1.head: χρεωφειλέτης
div1.sense: a debtor, one in debt, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: χρῄζω
div1.etym: used by Attic writers only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to need, want, lack, have need of, c. gen., Hom., Aesch.:—absol. in part. χρηίζων lacking, needy, poor, Od., Hes.

to desire, long for, ask for, c. gen., Hdt., Aesch.:— rarely c. acc. rei, Hdt., Soph.;—often an inf. must be supplied, φράζε ὅ τι χρῄζεις (sc. φράζειν) Ar., etc. b. c. acc. pers. et inf. to ask or desire that one should do a thing, Hdt.; so also c. gen. pers. et inf. to desire of one to do, Hdt.; c. inf. only, to desire to do a thing, Trag.
c. dupl. gen. pers. et rei, τῶνδε ἐγὼ ὑμέων χρηίζων συνέλεξα Hdt.
μὴ θανεῖν ἔχρῃζες (Soph. O. C. 1713) is explained, O that thou hadst not desired to die, —a very unusual construction; cf. ἐπωφέλησα for ὤφελον (supr. 541).
the part. χρῄζων is used absol. for εἰ χρῄζει, if one will, if one chooses, Theogn., Aesch.:—also, τὸ χρῇζον your solicitation, Eur.

div1.head: χρῄζω2
div1.sense: to deliver an oracle, foretell, Eur.

div0.div1: χρηΐσκομαι , Ionic Frequent. of χρῄζω to be much in want of, τινι Hdt.

div1.head: χρῆμα
div1.sense: a thing that one uses or needs: in pl. goods, property, money, gear, chattels, Od., Hes., etc.; πρόβατα καὶ ἄλλα χρ. Xen.; κρείσσων χρημάτων superior to money, i. e. incorruptible, Thuc.; χρημάτων ἀδωρότατος Thuc.:—rare in sg. in this sense, ἐπὶ κόσῳ χρήματι; for how much money? Answ. ἐπʼ οὐδενί, Hdt.
generally, a thing, matter, affair, event, Hes., Hdt.; κινεῖν πᾶν χρῆμα "to leave no stone unturned, " Hdt.:—of a battle, an affair, Plut.

χρῆμα is often expressed where it might be omitted, δεινὸν χρ. ἐποιεῦντο Hdt.; ἐς ἀφανὲς χρ. ἀποστέλλειν ἀποικίαν to send out a colony without any certain destination, Hdt.; τί χρῆμα; like τί; what? τί χρῆμα δρᾷς; Soph.; τί χρῆμα πάσχω; τί δʼ ἐστὶ χρῆμα; what is the matter? Aesch., etc.

used in periphrases to express something strange or extraordinary, μέγα συὸς χρῆμα a monster of a boar, Hdt.; τὸ χρ. τῶν νυκτῶν ὅσον what a terrible length the nights are, Ar.: λιπαρὸν τὸ χρ. τῆς πόλεως what a grand city! Ar.; κλέπτον τὸ χρ. τἀνδρός a thievish sort of fellow, Ar.; σοφόν τοι χρῆμʼ ἄνθρωπος truly a clever creature is he! Theocr.:—so, to express a great number, as we say, a lot, a deal, a heap, πολλόν τι χρ. τῶν ὀφίων, χρ. πολλὸν νεῶν Hdt.; ὅσον τὸ χρ. παρνόπων what a lot of locusts! Ar.; ὅσον τὸ χρ. πλακοῦντος Ar.; τὸ χρ. τῶν κόπων ὅσον what a lot of them! Ar.; —also of persons, χρῆμα θηλειῶν woman kind, Eur.; μέγα χρ. Λακαινᾶν Theocr.

div1.head: χρηματίζω
div1.sense: to negotiate, transact business, have dealings, esp. in money matters (though this sense is mostly confined to the Mid.), Thuc., Isocr.
to consult, deliberate, Dem., Aeschin.
to give audience to, to answer after deliberation, τινί Xen.; τινὶ περί τινος Thuc.
of an oracle, to give a response to those who consult it, Plut.:—Pass. to receive an answer or warning, NTest.; ἦν αὐτῷ κεχρηματισμένον a warning had been given him, NTest.
Mid. χρηματίζομαι, fut. Attic -ιοῦμαι: perf. κεχρημάτισμαι:— to negotiate or transact business for oneself, to make money, Thuc., Plat.; χρ. χρήματα Xen.
generally, to transact business, have dealings, hold conference with, τινι Hdt.
c. acc. rei, χρηματίζεσθαι τὸ νόμισμα to traffic in money, Arist.

in later writers, the Act. means to take and bear a title or name, to be called or styled so and so, χρηματίζει βασιλεύς Polyb.; Ἶσις ἐχρημάτισε Plut.; χρηματίσαι Χριστιανούς NTest.; generally, to be called, NTest.

div1.head: χρηματικός
div1.sense: of or for money, χρ. ζημία a money fine, Plut.; χρ. συμβόλαια money contracts, Plut.; οἱ χρηματικοί the moneyed men, Plut.

div1.head: χρηματισμός
div1.sense: an oracular response, divine warning, NTest.
(from Mid.) money making, Plat.: gain, profit, Dem.

div1.head: χρηματιστέος
div1.sense: one must make money, Xen.

div1.head: χρηματιστήριον
div1.sense: a place for transacting business, a counting-house, Plut.

div1.head: χρηματιστής
div1.sense: a man in business, money-getter, trafficker, Plat., Xen.
as adj., = χρημᾰτιστικός, Arist.

div1.head: χρηματιστικός
div1.sense: of or for money-making, ὁ χρ. a man of business, Plat.; χρ. οἰωνός an omen portending gain, Xen.; τὸ χρηματιστικόν the commercial class, Arist.:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , the art of money-making, traffic, Plat.

div1.head: χρηματοδαίτης
div1.sense: a divider of wealth, Aesch.

div1.head: χρηματοποιός
div1.sense: money-making, Xen.

div1.head: χρημοσύνη
div1.sense: like χρεία, need, want, lack, Tyrtae., Theogn.

div1.head: χρή
div1.etym: imperf. ἐχρῆν, also without the augm. χρῆν even in Attic
div1.sense: it is fated, necessary, Aesch., etc.; οὐδὲ ἓν ἴαμα ὅ τι χρῆν προσφέροντας ὠφελεῖν no one remedy which one was sure to do good by administering, Thuc.:—c. inf. it must, must needs, one must or ought to do, Hom., Attic; more often, like Lat. oportet, c. acc. pers. et inf. one must, one must needs, it behoves, befits one to . . , οὐδέ τί σε χρὴ νηλεὲς ἦτορ ἔχειν Il., etc.; often the inf. must be supplied from the context, τίπτε μάχης ἀποπαύεαι; οὐδέ τί σε χρή (sc. ἀποπαύεσθαι) , why cease from battle? for it behoves thee not, Il.; so, ὅθι χρὴ πεζὸν ἐόντα (sc. μάρνασθαι) Od.; ἐπιπλεύσειέ τις ὡς χρή (sc. ἐπιπλεῦσαι) Thuc.:—absol., ἐρεῖ τις, οὐ χρῆν [sc. τοῦτο ποιεῖν, ἀλλὰ τί χρῆν εἴπατε Eur. ap. Ar.
c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, οὐδέ τί σε χρὴ ἀφροσύνης thou hast no need of imprudence, i. e. it does not befit thee, Il.; μυθήσεαι ὅττεό (i. e. ὅτου) σε χρή thou wilt say what thou hast need of, Od.
sometimes in a less strong sense, πῶς χρὴ τοῦτο περᾶσαι; how is one to get through this? Theocr.
τὸ χρῆν (inf.) = χρεών, fate, destiny, Eur.

div1.head: χρῆ
div1.sense: need, necessity, χρῆ ʼσται, which serves as a fut. to χρή, it will be needful, c. inf., Soph.

div1.head: χρησιμεύω
div1.sense: to be useful or serviceable, τινί to one, Luc.

div1.head: χρήσιμος
div1.sense: useful, serviceable, good for use, good, apt or fit in its kind, Hdt., Attic; τὸ αὐτίκα χρ. present advantage, Thuc.; —χρ. εἴς τι useful for something, Hdt., etc.; ἐπί τι Plat.; πρός τι Eur.; useful for doing, Ar.
serviceable, useful, Soph., Eur., etc.; χρησίμους ἑαυτοὺς παρέχειν τῇ πόλει to shew themselves serviceable to the state, Dem.
much-used, Hdt.
νόμισμα οὐ χρήσιμον ἔξω money that will not pass abroad, Xen.
adv., χρησίμως ἔχειν to be serviceable, Thuc.; χρ. τινί with advantage to him, Thuc.

div1.head: χρῆσις
div1.sense: a using, employment, use made of a thing, Pind.: in pl. uses, advantages, Pind., Xen.:—opp. to κτῆσις (possession), Plat., etc.
means of using, usefulness, Thuc., Plat.; ἔχειν χρῆσιν to be useful, Dem.
intimacy, acquaintance, Lat. usus, Isocr.; ἡ χρ. ἡ πρὸς ἀλλήλους Arist.
(χράω. I), the response of an oracle, [Pind.
(χράω3. II), a lending, loan, Arist.

div1.head: χρησμαγόρης
div1.sense: an utterer of oracles, a prophet, Anth.

div1.head: χρησμηγορέω
div1.sense: to utter oracles, Luc.

div1.head: χρησμολογέω
div1.sense: to utter oracles, divine, Ar.

div1.head: χρησμολόγος
div1.sense: uttering oracles, divining, χ. ἀνήρ a soothsayer, diviner, Hdt.
an expounder of oracles, an oracle-monger, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: χρησμοποιός
div1.sense: making oracles in verse, Luc.

div1.head: χρησμός
div1.sense: the answer of an oracle, oracular response, oracle, Solon., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: χρησμοσύνη
div1.sense: need, want, poverty, Tyrtae.
importunity, Hdt.

div1.head: χρησμοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a keeper of oracles, Luc.

div1.head: χρησμῳδέω
div1.sense: to chant oracles: generally, to deliver oracles, prophesy, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: χρησμῳδία
div1.sense: the answer of an oracle, a prophecy, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: χρησμῳδικός
div1.sense: oracular, Luc.

div1.head: χρησμῳδός
div1.sense: chanting oracles, or delivering them in verse; generally prophesying, prophetic, χρ. παρθένος, of the Sphinx, Soph.
as Subst. a soothsayer, oracle-monger, Plat.

div1.head: χρηστέος
div1.sense: one must use, c. dat. rei, Xen.

div1.head: χρηστεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be good and kind, NTest.

div1.head: χρηστηριάζω
div1.sense: to give oracles, prophesy, Strab.
Mid., like χράομαι, to have an oracle given one, consult an oracle, Hdt.; χρ. θεῷ to consult a god, like χρήσασθαι θεῷ, Hdt.

div1.head: χρηστήριον
div1.sense: an oracle, i. e.,
the seat of an oracle, such as Delphi, Hhymn., Hdt., Eur.: —in pl. for sg., Aesch.
the answer of an oracle, oracular response, Hdt., Trag.
an offering for the oracle, made by those consulting it; generally, a sacrificial victim, χρ. θέσθαι Pind., Aesch.; —and a victim, sacrifice, Soph.

div1.head: χρηστήριος
div1.sense: of or from an oracle, oracular, prophetic, Aesch., Eur.; Ἄπολλον χρηστήριε author of oracles, Hdt.

div1.head: χρήστης
div1.etym: gen. pl. χρήστων (not χρηστῶν, to distinguish it from the gen. pl. of χρηστός.)
div1.sense: a creditor, usurer, dun, Ar.
(from the Mid.) a debtor, Dem.

div1.head: χρηστικός
div1.sense: knowing how to use, understanding the use of a thing, c. gen., Arist.
of things, useful, serviceable, Plut.

div1.head: χρηστοήθης
div1.sense: well-disposed, Arist.

div1.head: χρηστολογία
div1.sense: fair speaking, smooth speech, NTest.

div1.head: χρηστός
div1.sense: useful, good of its kind, serviceable, τινι Hdt., Eur.; of victims and omens, boding good, auspicious, Hdt.; τελευτὴ χρηστή a happy end or issue, Hdt.:— τὰ χρηστά, as Subst., good services, benefits, kindnesses, Hdt.; χρηστὰ συμβουλεύειν Ar.
in moral sense, good, opp. to μοχθηρός, Plat.; τὸ χρηστόν, opp. to τὸ αἰσχρόν, Soph.
of men, good, a good man and true; generally, good, honest, worthy, trusty, Hdt., Soph., etc.;—also like χρήσιμος, of good citizens, useful, deserving, Ar., Thuc., etc.
οἱ χρηστοί, like οἱ ἀγαθοί, Lat. optimates, Xen.
of the gods, kind, propitious, Hdt.
good, mild, kind, kindly, NTest.:—in bad sense, simple, silly, like εὐήθης, Ar., Plat.; ὦ χρηστέ Dem.
adv. -τῶς, well, properly, Hdt.

div1.head: χρηστότης
div1.sense: of persons, goodness, honesty, Eur.
goodness of heart, kindness, Isae., NTest.

div1.head: χρηστοφιλία
div1.sense: the having good friends, the friendship of good men, Arist.

div1.head: χρηστόφιλος
div1.sense: possessed of good friends, Arist.

div1.head: χρῖμα
div1.sense: older form of χρῖσμα, unguent, oil, Aesch.

div1.head: χρίμπτω
div1.sense: to bring near, (so used by Hom. only in compd. ἐγχρίμπτω, q. v.); πόδα χρίμπτουσα ῥαχίαισι keeping oneʼs steps close along the shore, Aesch.; ὑπὸ στήλην ἔχριμπτε ἀεὶ σύριγγα kept the wheel ever close to the post, Soph.; so in Mid., Eur., Theocr.:— Pass. to touch the surface of a body, to graze, scratch, wound, Lat. radere, stringere, χριμφθεὶς πέλας close even to touching, Od.: generally, to come nigh, draw near, approach, c. dat., δόμοισι χρίμπτεσθαι Aesch.; τείχεσι Eur.; so in aor1 mid. χρίμψασθαι, Hhymn.
intr. in Act., = Pass., Eur.

div1.head: χρῖσμα
div1.sense: anything smeared on, esp. a scented unguent, thicker than μύρον, Xen.
whitewash, stucco, Luc.

div1.head: Χριστιανός
div1.sense: a Christian, first in Act_ap. II. 26.

div1.head: χριστός
div1.sense: to be rubbed on, φάρμακα χριστά salves, Aesch., Eur.
of persons, anointed: χριστός, οῦ, ὁ, the Anointed One, the Christ, as a transl. of the Hebr. Messiah, NTest.

div1.head: χρίω
div1.sense: to touch on the surface: to rub or anoint with scented unguents, Hom.; λόεον καὶ χρῖον ἐλαίωι Od.; πέπλον χρ. to infect with poison, Soph.; metaph., ἱμέρωι χρίσασʼ οἰστόν Eur.:—Mid. to anoint oneself, Od., Hes.: c. acc. rei, χρίεσθαι ἰούς to anoint (i. e. poison) oneʼs arrows, Od.:—Pass., χρίεσθαι ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου, of a dead body left exposed to the sun, Hdt.
to rub over with colour: Pass. to be coloured, Hdt.:—Mid., χρίεσθαι τὰ σώματα to smear their bodies, Xen.
to wound on the surface, prick, sting, Aesch.:—Pass., ὀξυστόμωι μύωπι χρισθεῖσʼ Xen.

div1.head: χροιά
div1.sense: the surface of a body, the skin; the body itself, Il., Theogn., Ar.
the superficial appearance of a thing, its colour, Aesch., Eur., etc.:—esp. the colour of the skin, the complexion, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: χροΐζω
div1.sense: to touch on the surface; generally, to touch, Eur.

div1.head: χρόμαδος
div1.sense: a crashing sound, χρ. γενύων, of a pugilistic contest, Il.

div1.head: χρονίζω
div1.sense: intr. to spend time, Hdt.: to take time, tarry, linger, delay, be slow, Aesch., Thuc.; c. inf. to delay to do, NTest.
of things, χρονίζον μένειν to remain long, Aesch.
Pass. to be prolonged or protracted, Aesch.
to grow up, χρονισθείς Aesch.

div1.head: χρονικός
div1.sense: of or concerning time, κανόνες Plut.:— τὰ χρονικά (sc. βιβλία) chronology, Plut.

div1.head: χρόνιος
div1.sense: of persons, after a long time, late, χρόνιος ἐλθών Od.; χρ. φανείς Soph.
for a long time, χρόνιόν τινα ἐκβάλλειν, ἐλαύνειν Soph.; χρόνιός εἰμʼ ἀπὸ βορᾶς I have been long without food, Eur.
long-delaying, lingering, Aesch.; χρόνιοι μέλλετε πράσσειν Soph.; χρόνια τὰ τῶν θεῶν Eur.
of things, long, lasting long, long-continued, χρόνια λέκτρʼ ἔχων having been long married, Eur.; χρ. πόλεμοι Thuc.
adv. -ίως, Arist.: neut. pl. χρόνια as adv., Eur.:—comp. -ώτερον, Pind.

div1.head: χρονιστέος
div1.sense: one must spend time, Arist.

div1.head: χρονογράφος
div1.sense: recording times and events: as Subst. a chronicler, annalist, Strab.

div1.head: χρόνος
div1.sense: time, Hom., etc.

a definite time, a while, period, season, δεκέτης, τρίμηνος χρ. Soph.; χρ. βίου, ἥβης Eur.:—pl. periods of time, τοῖς χρόνοις ἀκριβῶς with chronological accuracy, Thuc.; τοῖς χρόνοις by the dates, Isocr.
Special phrases:
acc., χρόνον for a while, Od., etc.; so, πολὺν χρόνον for a long time, Od.; τὸν ἀεὶ χρ. for ever, Eur., etc.; ἕνα χρ. at once, once for all, Il.
gen., ὀλίγου χρόνου in a short time, Hdt.; πολλοῦ χρόνου Ar.; πόσου ρ.; for how long? Ar.
dat., χρόνῳ in time, at last, Hdt., Trag.; so, χρόνῳ ποτέ Hdt., etc.; also with the Art., τῷ χρόνῳ Ar.

with Prepositions:— ἀνὰ χρόνον in course of time, after a time, Hdt.:— ἀφʼ οὗ χρόνου from such time as . . , Xen.:— διὰ χρόνου after an interval of time, Soph., Thuc.; διὰ πολλοῦ χρόνου Hdt., Ar.:— ἐκ πολλοῦ χρόνου a long time since, long ago, Hdt.:— ἐν χρόνῳ in time, at length, Aesch.:— ἐντὸς χρόνου within a certain time, Hdt.:— ἐπὶ χρόνον for a while, Hom.; πολλὸν ἐπὶ χρ. Od.:— ἐς χρόνον hereafter, Hdt.:— σὺν χρόνῳ, like χρόνῳ or διὰ χρόνου, Aesch.:— ὑπὸ χρόνου by lapse of time, Thuc.
lifetime, an age, Soph.; χρόνῳ βραδύς Soph.
a season, portion of the year, Xen.
delay, loss, of time, Dem.; χρόνους ἐμποιεῖν to interpose delays, Dem.

div1.head: χρονοτριβέω
div1.sense: to waste time, loiter, Arist., NTest.
c. acc., χρ. τὸν πόλεμον to protract the war, Plut.

div1.head: χρυσαμοιβός
div1.sense: exchanging for gold:— metaph., Ἄρης σωμάτων χρυσαμοιβός War, who traffics in menʼs bodies, Aesch.

div1.head: χρυσάμπυξ
div1.sense: with fillet or frontlet of gold, of horses, Il.; of goddesses, Hhymn., Hes.

div1.head: χρυσανθής
div1.sense: with golden flower, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσανταυγής
div1.sense: reflecting golden light, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσάορος
div1.sense: like χρυσάωρ, with sword of gold, epith. of Apollo and other gods, Il., Hhymn., Pind.

div1.head: χρυσάρματος
div1.sense: with or in car of gold, Pind.,

div1.head: χρύσασπις
div1.sense: with shield of gold, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσαυγής
div1.sense: gold-gleaming, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: χρυσεῖον
div1.sense: a goldsmithʼs shop, Strab.
a gold-mine: in pl. χρυσεῖα, gold-mines, Xen.

div1.head: χρύσειος
div1.etym: Epic for χρύσεος q. v., Hom., Hes.

div1.head: χρυσελεφαντήλεκτρος
div1.sense: of gold, ivory, and electrum, overlaid therewith, Epigr. ap. Plut.

div1.head: χρυσεόδμητος
div1.sense: formed of gold, Aesch.

div1.head: χρυσεόκυκλος
div1.sense: with disk of gold, of the sun, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσεοπήνητος
div1.sense: with woof of gold, gold-inwoven, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσεοσάνδαλος
div1.sense: with sandals of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρύσεος
div1.note: χρύσεος, η, ον, Att. contr. χρυσοῦς, ῆ, οῦν (so ἀργύρεος, -οῦς, χάλκεος, -οῦς)
div1.sense: golden, of gold, decked or inlaid with gold, Hom., etc.: sometimes, = ἐπίχρυσος, gilded, gilt, Hdt.; cf. ἵστημι A. III.
χρύσεια μέταλλα gold mines, Thu.; v. χρυσεῖον II.
gold-coloured, golden-yellow, Il.
metaph. golden, χρυσέη Ἀφροδίτη Hom.; χρ. ὑγίεια Pind.; χρ. ἐλπίς Soph.; the first age of man was the golden, Hes.
div1.etym: χρῡσέη, χρῡσέην, χρῡσέου, χρῡσέῳ etc., in Hom. must be pronounced as disyll.

div1.head: χρυσεόστολμος
div1.sense: decked, dight with gold, Aesch.

div1.head: Χρυσηΐς
div1.sense: daughter of Chryses, Il.

div1.head: χρυσηλάκατος
div1.sense: with spindle of gold, Il., Soph.

div1.head: χρυσήλατος
div1.sense: of beaten gold, goldwrought, Trag.

div1.head: χρυσήνιος
div1.sense: with reins of gold, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: χρυσήρης
div1.sense: furnished or decked with gold, golden, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσίδιον
div1.sense: a small piece of gold, Isocr., Dem.

div1.head: χρυσίον
div1.sense: a piece of gold, generally, gold, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; pl., Dem.
gold coin, money, Eur., Ar., Plat., etc.; χρυσία pieces of gold, Plat.
as a term of endearment, my golden one! my little treasure! Ar., Anth.

div1.head: χρυσίς
div1.sense: a vessel of gold, piece of gold plate, Ar.
a gold-broidered dress or shoes, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσίτης
div1.sense: like gold, containing gold, ψάμμος χρυσῖτις Hdt.

div1.head: χρυσοβαφής
div1.sense: gilded, gold-embroidered, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: χρυσοβέλεμνος
div1.sense: with arrows of gold, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσόβωλος
div1.sense: with soil of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσόγονος
div1.sense: born or begotten of gold, χρ. γενεά, i. e. the Persians, because (by the legend) they were descended from Perseus, who was begotten of Zeus in the form of a shower of gold, Aesch.

div1.head: χρυσοδακτύλιος
div1.sense: with ring of gold, NTest.

div1.head: χρυσόδετος
div1.sense: bound with gold, set in gold, σφρηγίς Hdt.:— enriched with gold, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοειδής
div1.sense: like gold, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: χρυσόζυγος
div1.sense: with yoke of gold, Xen.

div1.head: χρυσόθρονος
div1.sense: gold-enthroned, Il., Pind.

div1.head: χρυσοκάρηνος
div1.sense: with head of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσόκερως
div1.sense: with horns of gold, Pind., Eur.
with gilded horns, of a victim ready for sacrifice, Aeschin.

div1.head: χρυσοκόλλητος
div1.sense: soldered or inlaid with gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοκόμης
div1.sense: the golden haired, Hes., Eur.;— ὁ Χρ. absol. for Apollo, Pind., Eur.
with golden ornaments in the hair, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσόκομος
div1.sense: with golden plumage, of birds, Hdt.

div1.head: χρυσολογέω
div1.sense: to speak of gold, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσόλογχος
div1.sense: with spear of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσολύρης
div1.sense: with lyre of gold, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: χρυσόμαλλος
div1.sense: with golden wool or fleece, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσομηλολόνθιον
div1.sense: little golden beetle, as a term of endearment, Ar.

div1.head: χρυσομίτρης
div1.sense: with girdle or headband of gold, Soph.

div1.head: χρυσόνωτος
div1.sense: with golden back or surface; χρ. ἡνία a rein studded with gold, Soph.

div1.head: χρυσόπαστος
div1.sense: sprinkled gold, gold-spangled, of gold tissue, Aesch.

div1.head: χρυσοπέδιλος
div1.sense: gold-sandalled, Od., Hes.

div1.head: χρυσοπήληξ
div1.sense: with helm of gold, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοπλόκαμος
div1.sense: golden-haired, Hhymn.

div1.head: χρυσοπλύσιον
div1.sense: a gold-wash, placer, where gold is washed from the river sand, Strab.

div1.head: χρυσοποιός
div1.sense: a goldsmith, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσόπρασος
div1.sense: the chrysoprase, a precious stone of golden-green colour, NTest.

div1.head: χρυσόπρυμνος
div1.sense: with gilded poop, Plut.

div1.head: χρυσόπτερος
div1.sense: with wings of gold, Il.

div1.head: χρυσορόης
div1.sense: with streams of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσόρραπις
div1.sense: with wand of gold, Od.

div1.head: χρυσόρρυτος
div1.sense: gold-streaming, Aesch.:—poet. χρῡσόρυτος, ον, γοναὶ χρ., of Perseus the son of Danae, Soph.

div1.head: χρυσός
div1.sense: gold, Lat. aurum, Hom., etc.; χρυσὸν ἔδυνε put on golden armour, Il.;— χρ. ἄπυρος unsmelted, opp. to χρ. ἄπεφθος (pure refined gold), Hdt.; λευκὸς χρυσός white gold, i. e. alloyed with silver, Hdt.; χρυσὸς κοῖλος gold wrought into vessels, gold plate, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσοστέφανος
div1.sense: gold-crowned, Hes., Eur., etc.; χρ. ἄεθλα in which the prize was a crown of gold, Pind.

div1.head: χρυσοτέκτων
div1.sense: a goldsmith, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσότερος
div1.sense: more golden, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσότευκτος
div1.sense: wrought of gold, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοτευχής
div1.sense: with golden armour, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσότοξος
div1.sense: with bow of gold, Pind.

div1.head: χρυσοτρίαινος
div1.sense: with trident of gold, Ar.

div1.head: χρυσότυπος
div1.sense: wrought of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσουργεῖον
div1.sense: a gold mine, Strab.

div1.head: χρυσοφαής
div1.sense: with golden light, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοφάλαρος
div1.sense: with trappings of gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοφεγγής
div1.sense: gold-beaming, Aesch.

div1.head: χρυσόφιλος
div1.sense: gold-loving, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσοφορέω
div1.sense: to wear golden ornaments or apparel, Hdt.: with golden scales, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing gold, i. e. golden ornaments, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοφύλαξ
div1.sense: keeping gold, χρ. θύλακος a money bag, Plut.:—as Subst. a gold-keeper, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: χρυσοχαίτης
div1.sense: golden-haired, Pind.

div1.head: χρυσοχάλινος
div1.sense: with gold-studded bridle, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: χρυσόχειρ
div1.sense: with gold rings, Luc.

div1.head: χρυσοχίτων
div1.sense: with coat of gold, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσοχοεῖον
div1.sense: the shop of a χρυσοχόος, ap. Dem.

div1.head: χρυσοχοέω
div1.sense: to work in gold, work as a goldsmith, Ar., Xen.
to smelt ore in order to get gold from it; whence χρυσοχοεῖν was used proverb. of those who fail in any tempting speculation, Plat.

div1.head: χρυσοχοϊκός
div1.sense: of or for a gold-smith, χρ. τέχνην ἐργάζεσθαι to follow the trade of a goldsmith, ap. Dem.

div1.head: χρυσοχόος
div1.sense: one who melts gold, of one who gilds the horns of a victim, Od.
a goldsmith, Dem.

div1.head: χρυσόχροος
div1.sense: gold-coloured, Anth.

div1.head: χρυσόω
div1.sense: to make golden, gild, Luc.:—Pass. to be gilded, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: χρύσωμα
div1.sense: wrought gold, Eur.

div1.head: χρυσωνέω
div1.sense: to change gold, Isocr.

div1.head: χρυσωπός
div1.sense: with golden face, beaming like gold, Eur.
gold-coloured, Plut.

div1.head: χρυσωρυχεῖον
div1.sense: a gold-mine, Strab.

div1.head: χρυσωρύχος
div1.sense: digging for gold, Strab.

div1.head: χρύσωσις
div1.sense: a gilding, Plut.

div1.head: χρῴζω
div1.sense: to touch the surface of a body, and generally, to touch, γόνατα μὴ χρώζειν ἐμά Eur.
to tinge, stain, χρωσθεὶς ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου Luc.
to defile, Anth.: metaph. in Pass., κεχρώσμεθα κακοῦ πρὸς ἀνδρός Eur.

div1.head: χρῶμα
div1.sense: the surface, skin: the colour of the skin, the complexion, Hdt.; χρῶμα ἀλλάσσειν Eur.; μεθιστάναι τοῦ χρώματος Ar.
generally, colour, Plat., Xen.:—metaph. in pl. ornaments, embellishments, Plat.; embellishments in music, Plat.

div1.head: χρωμάτιον
div1.sense: a colour, paint, Anth.

div1.head: χρώς
div1.sense: like χρόα (χροιά) , the surface of the body, the skin, Hom.: also the flesh, opp. to the bone, Hom.:—generally, the body, frame, Pind., Trag.

ἐν χροΐ, Attic ἐν χρῷ, close to the skin, ἐν χροΐ κείρειν to shave close, Hdt.; ἐν χρῷ κεκαρμένος Xen.:—metaph., ξυρεῖ γὰρ ἐν χρῷ τοῦτο it touches one nearly, comes home, Soph.; ἐν χρῷ παραπλέειν to sail past so as to shave or graze, Lat. radere, Thuc.:—absol., ἐν χρῷ (also written ἐγχρῷ or ἐγχρῶ) , near at hand, hard by, Luc.
the colour of the skin, complexion, Hom., Eur.
generally, colour, Aesch.

div1.head: χρωτίζω
div1.sense: to colour:—Mid., χρωτίζεσθαι τὴν φύσιν to tinge oneʼs nature, Ar.

div1.head: χύδην
div1.sense: in floods or heaps; hence,
without order, at random, promiscuously, Plat., Anth.
in flowing language, i. e. in prose, Arist.
abundantly, wholly, utterly, Anth.

div1.head: χυλός
div1.sense: juice, esp. juice produced by decoction or digestion:—metaph., χυλὸν διδοὺς στωμυλμάτων administering a decoction of small talk, Ar.; χ. φιλίας Ar.

div1.head: χυμός
div1.sense: juice, Plat.

div1.head: χύσις
div1.sense: a flood, stream, Aesch.
of dry things, a heap, φύλλων χ. Od.: a quantity, σαρκῶν Anth.
metaph. of the lapse of time, Anth.

div1.head: χυτλάζω
div1.sense: to pour out: metaph. to throw carelessly down, χύτλασον σεαυτὸν ἐν τοῖς στρώμασιν Ar.

trans.i: anything that can be poured: water and oil for the bath.

div1.head: χυτλόω
div1.sense: to wash:—Mid. to anoint oneself after bathing, Od.

div1.head: χυτός
div1.sense: poured, shed, αἷμα χυτόν blood shed, Aesch.
of dry things, shot out, heaped up, χυτὴ γαῖα a mound of earth, a sepulchral mound, Hom.:—as Subst., χυτός, οῦ, χῶμα, a mound, bank, dike, Hdt.
melted, ἀρτήματα λίθινα χυτά pendants of melted stone, Hdt.
generally, liquid, flowing, Pind., Anth.

div1.head: χύτρα
div1.sense: an earthen pot, a pot for boiling, pipkin, Lat. olla, Ar., Xen.
χύτραι, pots of pulse offered to inferior deities, Ar.

div1.head: χυτρεοῦς
div1.sense: of earthenware, Ar.

div1.head: χυτρεύς
div1.sense: a potter, Lat. figulus, Plat.

div1.head: χυτρίδιον
div1.sense: a small pot, cup, Ar.

div1.head: χυτρόπους
div1.sense: a pot with feet, or a portable stove for putting a pot upon, Hes.

div1.head: χύτρος
div1.sense: = χύτρα.
οἱ Χύτροι was the name given to the hot baths at Thermopylae, Hdt.
the pot-feast, the 3rd day of the Anthesteria, and 13th of the month Anthesterion, Ar.

div1.head: χωλαίνω
div1.sense: to be or go lame, Plat.

div1.head: χωλεία
div1.sense: lameness, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: χωλεύω
div1.sense: to be or become lame, to halt, limp, Il., Xen.
trans. to make lame:— Pass. to be lame, Luc.: generally, to be maimed or imperfect, Plat.

div1.head: χωλίαμβος
div1.sense: a lame iambic, i. e. one that has a spondee for an iambus in the last place, said to be invented by Hipponax.

div1.head: χωλοποιός
div1.sense: making lame, of Euripides, as being fond of introducing lame men upon the stage, Ar.

div1.head: χωλός
div1.sense: lame in the feet, halting, limping, χωλὸς πόδα Hom.; χωλὸς ἀμφοτέροις (sc. ποσί) Luc.
metaph. maimed, imperfect, defective, Lat. mancus, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: χῶμα
div1.sense: earth thrown up, a bank, mound, thrown up against the walls of cities to take them, Hdt., Thuc.:— a dike to hinder a river from overflowing, Hdt.:— a dam, Hdt.:— a mole or pier, carried out into the sea, Lat. moles, Hdt., Dem.
like Lat. tumulus, a sepulchral mound, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: χωνεύω
div1.sense: to cast into a mould (χόανος), Ar.
to cast metal: —Pass., κεχωνευμένος Plut.

div1.head: χώννυμι
div1.sense: later form of χόω, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: χώομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to be angry, wroth, indignant, Hom.; χωόμενος κῆρ, θυμόν Il.; κηρόθι Od.
c. dat. pers. to be angry at one, ὅτε χώσεται ἀνδρί Il.
c. gen. pers. vel rei, χωόμενος γυναικός about or because of her, Il.; χώσατο δʼ αἰνῶς νίκης τε καὶ ἔγχεος Il.
c. acc. rei, only in the phrase μή μοι τόδε χώεο be not angry with me for this, Od.

div1.head: χώρα
div1.sense: the space in which a thing is, Lat. locus, οὐδέ τι πολλὴ χώρη μεσσηγύς Il.; ὀλίγῃ ἐνὶ χώρῃ Il.
generally, a place, Hom.

oneʼs place, position, ἐν χώρῃ ἕζεσθαι Il.; esp. a soldierʼs post, χώραν λείπειν Thuc.; χώραν λαβεῖν to find oneʼs place, ἕως ἂν χώραν λάβῃ τὰ πράγματα till they are brought into position, into order, Xen.

metaph. oneʼs place in life, station, place, position, Ἄρης δʼ οὐκ ἐνὶ χώρᾳ the spirit of war is not there, Aesch.; ἐν ἀνδραπόδων or μισθοφόρων χώρᾳ εἶναι to be in the position of slaves or mercenaries, Xen.; ἐν οὐδεμιᾷ χώρᾳ εἶναι to be in no esteem, nullo loco haberi, Xen.:—also, κατὰ χώραν (χώρην) εἶναι, ἔχειν to be in oneʼs place, to keep a thing in its place, Hdt., Ar.; κατὰ χ. μένειν to stand oneʼs ground, Hdt., Attic
land, viz.,
a land, country, Lat. regio, Od., Hdt., Trag.
a piece of land, an estate, farm, Lat. ager, Xen.
the country, opp. to the town, Lat. rus, τὰ ἐκ τῆς χώρας, ὁ ἐκ τῆς χώρας σῖτος Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: χωρέω
div1.sense: to make room for another, give way, draw back, retire, withdraw, Il.; γαῖα ἔνερθεν χώρησεν the earth gave way from beneath, i. e. opened, Hhymn.;— πρύμναν χ. κρούεσθαι πρύμναν, to put back, retire, Eur.; — χωρεῖτε begone! Aesch.—Construction:
c. gen. loci, χώρησεν ἐπάλξιος he retired from the rampart, Il.; also, ἀπὸ ὑσμίνης χωρήσαντες Il.; ἐκ πυλῶν Aesch.
c. dat. pers. to give way to one, retire before him, οὐδʼ ἂν Ἀχιλλῆι χωρήσειεν Il.

to go forward, move on or along, Lat. incedere, and then simply to go or come, Hdt., etc.: to go on oneʼs journey, travel, Soph.; χ. πρὸς ἔργον to come to action, come on, begin, Soph.; χ. πρὸς ἧπαρ to go to oneʼs heart, Soph.; διὰ φόνου χ. Eur.; κάτω χώρει go downwards, i. e. beginning from the upper parts of the body, Aesch.:—absol., χ. ὁ ποταμός Plat.; ὁμόσε χ. to join battle, Thuc.; of Time, νὺξ ἐχώρει the night was passing, near an end, Aesch.: —also c. acc. loci, Κεκροπίαν χθόνα χ. Eur.
to go on, advance, Lat. procedere, οὐ χωρεῖ τοὖργον Ar.; τόκοι χωροῦσιν Ar.
to come to an issue, turn out in a certain manner, παρὰ σμικρὰ κεχώρηκε have come to little, of oracles, Hdt.; εὐτυχέως χ., Lat. bene cedere, Hdt.:—absol., like προχωρέω, to go on well, succeed, Hdt.
to spread abroad, Hdt.; διὰ πάντων χωρεῖν to spread among all, Xen.

trans. = χανδάνω, to have room for a thing, to hold, contain, esp. of measures, ὁ κρητὴρ χωρέει ἀμφορέας ἑξακοσίους Hdt.; ἡ πόλις οὐκ ἐχώρησεν αὐτούς Thuc.; χωρήσατε ἡμᾶς take us into your hearts, NTest.

div1.head: χωρίζω
div1.sense: in local sense, to separate, part, sever, divide one thing from another, τί τινος Eur., Plat.; τι ἀπό τινος Plat.:— χ. πάντα κατὰ φυλάς Xen.;— οἱ χωρίζοντες the Separaters, a name given to those Grammarians who ascribed the Iliad and Odyssey to different authors:—Pass. to be separated, severed, divided, Hdt., Eur.

to separate in thought, to distinguish, τὸ ἡδύ τε καὶ δίκαιον Plat., etc.:—Pass. to differ, to be different, κεχωρίδαται πολλὸν τῶν ἄλλων ἀνθρώπων Hdt.; more rarely, χωρίζεσθαί τινι Hdt.; νόμοι κεχωρισμένοι τῶν ἄλλων ἀνθρώπων laws apart from the others, far different, Hdt.

div1.head: χωρίον
div1.sense: a particular place, a place, spot, district, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἐκ τοῦ αὐτοῦ χ. this same spot, Hdt.
a place, post, esp. a fortified post, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
landed property, an estate, Thuc., Xen.
a place of business, office, Dem.
in Geometry, a space enclosed by lines, Ar., Plat.
= τόπος I. 3, a place, passage in a book, Luc.: a part or period of history, Thuc.

div1.head: χωρισμός
div1.sense: separation, Plat.

div1.head: χωρίς
div1.sense: separately, asunder, apart, by oneself or by themselves, Hom.; κεῖται χ. ὁ νεκρός Hdt.; χ. θέσθαι to set apart, keep in reserve, Thuc.; χ. οἰκεῖν to live apart, Dem.; μή με χ. αἰτιῶ accuse me not without evidence, Soph.; χ. ποιεῖν to distinguish, Isocr.; χωρὶς δέ . . , and separately, besides, Thuc.: — separately, one by one, Lys.; χωρὶς ἤ except, χ. ἢ ὅτι except that, Hdt.; χ. ἢ ὅκοσοι except so many as, Hdt.
metaph. of different nature, kind, or quality, Soph., Eur.
as prep. c. gen. without, Aesch., Soph., etc.; χ. Ζηνός without his help or will, Lat. sine Diis, Soph.
separate from, apart or aloof from, far from, χ. ἀνθρώπων στίβου Soph.; ἡ ψυχὴ χ. τοῦ σώματος Plat.
independent of, without reckoning, not to mention, besides, Hdt., Aesch.
differently from, otherwise than, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: χωριστέος
div1.sense: one must separate, τι ἀπό τινος Plat.

div1.head: χωριστός
div1.sense: in local sense, separated, separable, Arist.
separate or separable in thought, Arist.

div1.head: χωρίτης
div1.sense: a countryman, rustic, boor, Xen., Anth.:—fem. χωρῖτις, ιδος, a country girl, Luc.
one dwelling in a spot or country, a native, Aesch.

div1.head: χωριτικός
div1.sense: of or like a countryman, rustic, rural, Plut.: adv. -κῶς, in rustic fashion, Xen.

div1.head: χωρογραφέω
div1.sense: to describe countries, Strab.

div1.head: χωρογραφικός
div1.sense: of or for the description of countries, Strab.

div1.head: χωρογράφος
div1.sense: describing countries, Strab.

div1.head: Χῶρος
div1.sense: the North-west wind, Lat. Caurus, NTest.

div1.head: χῶρος
div1.sense: a piece of ground, ground, place, Hom., etc.
a land, country, Hdt.; in pl. lands, places, Hdt., Soph.
land, an estate, Xen.
the country, Lat. rus, Xen.

div1.head: χωροφιλέω
div1.sense: to haunt a place, Antipho.

div1.head: χῶσις
div1.sense: a heaping up, esp. of earth, raising a mound or bank, esp. against a city, Thuc.
a filling in, blocking up by earth thrown in, Thuc.

div1.head: χωστός
div1.sense: made by earth thrown up, Eur.
